paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a pathogenic variant in the KCNH2 gene associated with long QT syndrome in a patient with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.

individual_records.phenotype_details: prolonged QT interval, PMVT/VF cardiac arrest
individual_records.evidence_sentence: This identified a pathogenic heterozygous variant in the KCNH2 (potassium voltage-gated channel subfamily H member 2) gene (c.1468G>A (p.Ala490Thr)).

individual_records.phenotype_details: has HCM and the MYBPC3 variant also has the KCNH2 variant
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Thus far, we have confirmed that the index case’s father and 1 paternal uncle who have HCM and the MYBPC3 variant also have the KCNH2 variant.

individual_records.phenotype_details: has HCM and the MYBPC3 variant also has the KCNH2 variant
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Thus far, we have confirmed that the index case’s father and 1 paternal uncle who have HCM and the MYBPC3 variant also have the KCNH2 variant.

individual_records.phenotype_details: phenotypically negative, carry either the MYBPC3 variant alone, KCNH2 variant alone, or both MYBPC3 and KCNH2 variants
individual_records.evidence_sentence: We also identified paternal first cousins, children of the uncle who had genetic testing, that are phenotypically negative, who carry either the MYBPC3 variant alone, KCNH2 variant alone, or both MYBPC3 and KCNH2 variants.

functional_data.summary: The functional impact of the KCNH2 variant on cardiac repolarization is implied by the prolonged QT interval observed in the patient.

variants.segregation_data: The KCNH2 variant segregates with disease in the family, as both the father and paternal uncle are affected.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence based on clinical presentation and family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The patient had a history of prolonged QT interval and experienced life-threatening arrhythmias.
key_quotes: Given his markedly prolonged QTc interval exceeding 500 ms without an identifiable reversible etiology, along with PMVT/VF, we also performed genetic testing for congenital LQTS.
The finding of a pathogenic variant in KCNH2 in our patient had affected his management.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 variant was extracted from the main text.
